CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4,5 Nevertheless , most of these side - chain D-A conjugated polymers did not exhibit comparable device performance to their main - chain D-A counterpart polymers. In order to develop high - performance side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , it is necessary to develop new catalog of side - chain D-A polymers for efficient PSCs. Given that benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDT ) unit has a large planar molecular structure by fusing a benzene with two flanking thiophenyl units and diketopyrrolopyrrole ( DPP ) , i.e. , pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione unit has a well conjugated structure with strong π-π interaction and electron - withdrawing effect , some main - chain D-A copolymers based on DPP or / and BDT units as prime building block had been designed for optoelectronic applications in both thin - film transistors and solar cells in recent years. 6 It is worthy to note that PSCs based on these copolymers with a tandem structure showed an increasing PCE of 8.62% . 2a Here we report another novel sidechain D-A conjugated copolymer ( PBDT-TDPP-S ) for highperformance PSCs , in which the BDT and thiophene units are conjugatedly formed the main chain and the di(thiophen-2yl)pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione ( TDPP ) units are pended onto the thiophenyl units to build the side chain by a linkage of a 2-vinylthiophenyl unit. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and PC71BM as electron acceptor , the resulting PSCs exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a PCE of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.84 V , a shortcircuit current ( J SC ) of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor ( FF ) of 56.0% . To our best knowledge , the efficiency is among the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers and is twice higher than that of the main - chain D-A counterpart polymer PBDTDPP-OR in the single BHJ PSCs. synthesized by a common Stille coupling reaction using Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 as catalyst with a high yield of 78.7% , as shown in Scheme 1. For comparison , the corresponding main - chain D-A conjugated copolymer of PBDT - DPP was made at the same time. The resulting PBDT-TDPP-S showed good solubility in common organic solvents , such as chlorobenzene , o-dichlorobenzene , and dichloromethane ( DCM ) , but PBDT - DPP was nearly not soluble in them. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) analysis showed that PBDT-TDPP-S has a numberaverage molecular weight ( M n ) of 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1 with a polydispersity index of 1.27 ( Figure S1 ). Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) indicated that PBDT-TDPP-S has high thermal stability with a degradation temperature ( T d ) of 364 °C at 5% weight loss. The corresponding molecular weights and thermal properties of PBDT-TDPP-S are summarized in Table 1 , and the recorded TGA curve is shown in Figure S2 ( see Supporting Information ) . The UV - vis absorption spectra of PBDT-TDPP-S in DCM solution and solid film are shown in Figure 1a.

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the Material Names in the paragraph:

* PBDT-TDPP-S
* PBDT-DPP
* PBDT
* TDPP
* DPP
* PC71BM

2. Now, let's check if any of these Material Names have been mentioned as "prime building blocks" or "units" in the paragraph:

* PBDT-TDPP-S: No
* PBDT-DPP: No
* PBDT: Yes (mentioned as a prime building block for main-chain D-A copolymers)
* TDPP: Yes (mentioned as a unit in the structure of PBDT-TDPP-S)
* DPP: Yes (mentioned as a unit in the structure of PBDT-DPP)
* PC71BM: No (not mentioned as a building block or unit)

3. Therefore, the Material Names that can be considered as "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

* PBDT
* TDPP
* DPP

These are the Material Names that have been mentioned as prime building blocks or units in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Names in the given paragraph:

* PBDT
* TDPP
* DPP

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid Material Names entities:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT |
| TDPP |
| DPP |

Paragraph: 4,5 Nevertheless , most of these side - chain D-A conjugated polymers did not exhibit comparable device performance to their main - chain D-A counterpart polymers. In order to develop high - performance side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , it is necessary to develop new catalog of side - chain D-A polymers for efficient PSCs. Given that benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDT ) unit has a large planar molecular structure by fusing a benzene with two flanking thiophenyl units and diketopyrrolopyrrole ( DPP ) , i.e. , pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione unit has a well conjugated structure with strong π-π interaction and electron - withdrawing effect , some main - chain D-A copolymers based on DPP or / and BDT units as prime building block had been designed for optoelectronic applications in both thin - film transistors and solar cells in recent years. 6 It is worthy to note that PSCs based on these copolymers with a tandem structure showed an increasing PCE of 8.62% . 2a Here we report another novel sidechain D-A conjugated copolymer ( PBDT-TDPP-S ) for highperformance PSCs , in which the BDT and thiophene units are conjugatedly formed the main chain and the di(thiophen-2yl)pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione ( TDPP ) units are pended onto the thiophenyl units to build the side chain by a linkage of a 2-vinylthiophenyl unit. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and PC71BM as electron acceptor , the resulting PSCs exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a PCE of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.84 V , a shortcircuit current ( J SC ) of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor ( FF ) of 56.0% . To our best knowledge , the efficiency is among the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers and is twice higher than that of the main - chain D-A counterpart polymer PBDTDPP-OR in the single BHJ PSCs. synthesized by a common Stille coupling reaction using Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 as catalyst with a high yield of 78.7% , as shown in Scheme 1. For comparison , the corresponding main - chain D-A conjugated copolymer of PBDT - DPP was made at the same time. The resulting PBDT-TDPP-S showed good solubility in common organic solvents , such as chlorobenzene , o-dichlorobenzene , and dichloromethane ( DCM ) , but PBDT - DPP was nearly not soluble in them. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) analysis showed that PBDT-TDPP-S has a numberaverage molecular weight ( M n ) of 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1 with a polydispersity index of 1.27 ( Figure S1 ). Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) indicated that PBDT-TDPP-S has high thermal stability with a degradation temperature ( T d ) of 364 °C at 5% weight loss. The corresponding molecular weights and thermal properties of PBDT-TDPP-S are summarized in Table 1 , and the recorded TGA curve is shown in Figure S2 ( see Supporting Information ) . The UV - vis absorption spectra of PBDT-TDPP-S in DCM solution and solid film are shown in Figure 1a.

Let's think step by step.

1. Benzene
2. Thiophene
3. Diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP)
4. Pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione
5. Benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDT)
6. 2-vinylthiophenyl
7. Di(thiophen-2-yl)pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione (TDPP)
8. PBDT-TDPP-S
9. PC71BM
10. Pd(PPh3)4
11. Chlorobenzene
12. o-Dichlorobenzene
13. Dichloromethane (DCM)

Note: PBDT-TDPP-S and PC71BM are not actually materials, but rather copolymers or compounds made from the materials listed above.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

In order to develop high - performance side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , it is necessary to develop new catalog of side - chain D-A polymers for efficient PSCs. Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* Molecular weight (Mn)
* Polydispersity index (PDI)
* Thermal stability (Td)
* UV-vis absorption spectra
2. Now, let's look for the values of these material properties in the paragraph:

* Molecular weight (Mn): 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1
* Polydispersity index (PDI): 1.27
* Thermal stability (Td): 364 °C (at 5% weight loss)
* UV-vis absorption spectra: not specified (but mentioned as being shown in Figure 1a)
3. Finally, let's convert the values to the appropriate units:

* Molecular weight (Mn): 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1 (no unit conversion needed)
* Polydispersity index (PDI): 1.27 (no unit conversion needed)
* Thermal stability (Td): 364 °C (°C is the unit)

So, the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph are:

* Molecular weight (Mn): 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1
* Polydispersity index (PDI): 1.27
* Thermal stability (Td): 364 °C
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to the Value of Material Property:

* Molecular weight (Mn): 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1
* Thermal stability (Td): 364 °C (at 5% weight loss)

I removed the entity "Polydispersity index (PDI): 1.27" since it is not a measure of the value of a material property, but rather a measure of the distribution of molecular weights in a polymer.
